item.title: TonRunner
item.description:
TonRunner

I am fortunate enough to be the event director of Tonbridge parkrun so there will be plenty of posts from there.

item.title: 2016 Race Schedule
item.description:
2016 Race Schedule

I like competing, I never used to but I have found more and more that I do. It maybe that I have come to accept that I am not really competing against anyone else merely against myself; can I go further faster or higher than I have done before. I think it also comes with the realisation that there is always going to be somebody better than you.

item.title: Dame Kelly Holmes joins in Tonbridge Park Run
item.description:
Dame Kelly Holmes joins in Tonbridge Park Run

Partakers in this morning's Tonbridge Park run were put through their paces by double Olympic champion Kelly Holmes. The dame joined runners at the 5km weekly event, which starts at 9am every Saturday in Tonbridge Park. She tweeted afterwards that the biggest challenge was the bitingly cold temperatures.

item.title: 5 Ways A Morning Run Will Change Your Life - Running Motivation
item.description:

item.title: Sub 3hr marathon training, Spring '16
item.description:
Sub 3hr marathon training, Spring '16

One of the many things I have learned about running and in particular training,  over the last five years is that you can only succeed if you have a goal. If you don't have a goal there is no incentive to train 'hard'. I use the term 'hard' because I actually enjoy running and would more than happily just go for a jog in the countryside, but that is not training. What I mean is having the discipline to go out when the weather is lashing it down, pushing yourself for that last 2miles of a threshold run when it would be so easy to pack it in early, after all who is ever going to know?

item.title: [Run Tip#1]:
item.description:
[Run Tip#1]:

Runners as a rule rarely warm-up beyond lacing up and starting off slow. Yes the occasional toe touch goes in the right direction...but falls woefully short of "undoing" all the time spent in stiff positions at work, in the car, or at home.!
